Notes.Text:
This update for vsftpd fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2021-3618: Enforced security checks against ALPACA attack (PM-3322, bsc#1187686, bsc#1187678).

Bugfixes:
- Fixed a seccomp failure in FIPS mode when SSL was enabled (bsc#1052900).
- Allowed wait4() to be called so that the broker can wait for its child processes (bsc#1021387).
- Allowed sendto() syscall when /dev/log support is enabled (bsc#786024).

Vulnerabilities.Description: ALPACA is an application layer protocol content confusion attack, exploiting TLS servers implementing different protocols but using compatible certificates, such as multi-domain or wildcard certificates. A MiTM attacker having access to victim's traffic at the TCP/IP layer can redirect traffic from one subdomain to another, resulting in a valid TLS session. This breaks the authentication of TLS and cross-protocol attacks may be possible where the behavior of one protocol service may compromise the other at the application layer.
